definition: to be born/to come into being/to withdraw from worldly affairs

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
life/age/generation/era/world/lifetime/epoch/descendant/noble
surname Shi

sentences.english: This gave the Chinese people a better sense of balance in regard to this-worldlincss and other- worldliness .
sentences.chinese: 這使得中國人對於入世和出世具有良好的平衡感。

sentences.english: Abide, friend, your mother bided till you were born.
sentences.chinese: 堅持啊朋友，母親善堅持，你方能出世。

sentences.english: The education there is addressed both to Sangha and lay people, in the form of human knowledge and transmundane dharmas combined.
sentences.chinese: 此基地採取世法和出世法相結合的教育形式。

sentences.english: Chapter two studied the content of Liu Chang's poem, and learnt the positive and negative thought showed in his poems.
sentences.chinese: 第二章通過劉敞詩歌內容分析其出世精神與入世情懷。

sentences.english: They were expecting their first brood of baby crocks.
sentences.chinese: 兩位正期待着他們的第一胎鱷魚寶寶出世。

sentences.english: Actually, if 35 billion years ago plants had not appeared on the earth.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，若無三十五億年前植物在地球上的橫空出世。

sentences.english: He hasn't heared of the news that his son was born.
sentences.chinese: 他還沒有聽到兒子出世的消息。

sentences.english: If the timing had been different, those children would never have been born.
sentences.chinese: 如果時機有所不同，這些孩子們就不會出世了。

sentences.english: His this-worldly idea was abundant and integrated, and the contour of the otherworldly idea was also formed.
sentences.chinese: 其入世思想豐富完整，出世思想也初具輪廓。

sentences.english: In Russia, a 73-year-old man had his 102nd grandchild.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯一名73歲老人的第102個孫子出世。

sentences.english: Most of them came into the world during the War of Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 他們大多數人是解放戰爭期間出世的。

sentences.english: In the first few weeks of life, a baby has no real control over its arms and legs.
sentences.chinese: 剛出世的幾周內，寶寶其實控制不了自己的四肢。

sentences.english: Like creatures that only come out in the night.
sentences.chinese: 像那些僅在夜裏出世的生靈。

sentences.english: And one year after, their first child is born.
sentences.chinese: 一年後，他們的第一個孩子出世了。

sentences.english: The cloisters still retain something of the quiet and seclusion of former days.
sentences.chinese: 迴廊一帶依然保留有幾分當年的幽靜出世之慨。

sentences.english: Except for the goose herself, Charlotte was the first to know that the goslings had at last arrived.
sentences.chinese: 除了母鵝之外，夏洛是第一個得知小鵝出世的消息的。

definition: to be born/arrival of newborn/birth (of a savior or religious leader)
this life/to lose face/to be disgraced
lit. to descend to earth (of an immortal)/to be born
to engage with secular society/to involve oneself in human affairs/to join the WTO (abbr. for 加入世界貿易組織|加入世界贸易组织[jia1 ru4 Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zu3 zhi1])
to descend/to arrive/to come
to levitate heavenwards (a Daoist success)/to take off/to soar (of prices)
reincarnation or transmigration (Buddhism)
to reach illumination (Buddhism)
newborn/nascent/primary (biology)
to achieve the Dao/to become an immortal
to be pregnant/to produce offspring/to nurture (a development, school of thought, artwork etc)/fig. replete with (culture etc)
the world/this world/the world of the living
to fall down/to decay/to fall from the sky/to die
nirvana (Buddhism)
the distant past/ancient times/antiquity/early historical times
see 隕落|陨落[yun3 luo4]
